docs.lead_paragraph: PRESIDENT BUSH was greeted by several hundred union-organized protesters -- mostly older and mostly retired -- when he visited Pittsburgh early last month for a political fund-raiser. The incident, however, was virtually ignored by the national news media. The protesters' main concern was health care, in the wake of the Senate's recent failure to reach a compromise on a prescription drug program for the elderly. Many of the demonstrators were retired steelworkers who lost their health care benefits when the LTV Corporation stopped production this spring and sold its assets in bankruptcy court. Federal law helps protect pensions in such cases, but not benefits.

headline.main: In an Election Year, These Protesters Have Power

docs.abstract: Fred Brock Seniority column on recent protest Pres Bush faced in wake of Senate's failure to reach compromise on prescription drug program for elderly; holds episode could be harbinger of contention in coming Senate and House races; drawing (M)
